trans-unit.source: By using Azure Backup and Recovery Services, you can back up and restore data and applications from Windows Servers, Windows client machines, System Center DPM servers and Azure virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: By using Azure Backup and Recovery Services, you can back up and restore data and applications from Windows Servers, Windows client machines, System Center DPM servers and Azure virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup is the service that you use to back up and restore your data in the Microsoft cloud.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup is the service that you use to back up and restore your data in the Microsoft cloud.

trans-unit.source: It replaces your existing on-premises or off-site backup solution with a cloud-based solution that is reliable, secure, and cost-competitive.
trans-unit.target: It replaces your existing on-premises or off-site backup solution with a cloud-based solution that is reliable, secure, and cost-competitive.

trans-unit.source: It also helps protect assets that run in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: It also helps protect assets that run in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup provides recovery services built on a world-class infrastructure that is scalable, durable, and highly available.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup provides recovery services built on a world-class infrastructure that is scalable, durable, and highly available.

trans-unit.source: Watch a video overview of Azure Backup
trans-unit.target: Watch a video overview of Azure Backup

trans-unit.source: Traditional backup solutions have evolved to treat the cloud as an endpoint similar to disks or tape.
trans-unit.target: Traditional backup solutions have evolved to treat the cloud as an endpoint similar to disks or tape.

trans-unit.source: While this approach is simple, it is also limited.
trans-unit.target: While this approach is simple, it is also limited.

trans-unit.source: It does not take full advantage of an underlying cloud platform and translates to an inefficient, expensive solution.
trans-unit.target: It does not take full advantage of an underlying cloud platform and translates to an inefficient, expensive solution.

trans-unit.source: In contrast, Azure Backup delivers all the advantages of a powerful and affordable cloud backup solution.
trans-unit.target: In contrast, Azure Backup delivers all the advantages of a powerful and affordable cloud backup solution.

trans-unit.source: Here are some of the key benefits that Azure Backup provides.
trans-unit.target: Here are some of the key benefits that Azure Backup provides.

trans-unit.source: No capital expenditure is needed for on-premises storage devices.
trans-unit.target: No capital expenditure is needed for on-premises storage devices.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup automatically allocates and manages backup storage, and it uses a pay-as-you-use consumption model.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup automatically allocates and manages backup storage, and it uses a pay-as-you-use consumption model.

trans-unit.source: Take advantage of high availability guarantees without the overhead of maintenance and monitoring.
trans-unit.target: Take advantage of high availability guarantees without the overhead of maintenance and monitoring.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup uses the underlying power and scale of the Azure cloud, with its nonintrusive autoscaling capabilities.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup uses the underlying power and scale of the Azure cloud, with its nonintrusive autoscaling capabilities.

trans-unit.source: Choose your backup storage based on need:
trans-unit.target: Choose your backup storage based on need:

trans-unit.source: A locally redundant storage block blob is ideal for price-conscious customers, and it still helps protect data against local hardware failures.
trans-unit.target: A locally redundant storage block blob is ideal for price-conscious customers, and it still helps protect data against local hardware failures.

trans-unit.source: A geo-replication storage block blob provides three more copies in a paired datacenter.
trans-unit.target: A geo-replication storage block blob provides three more copies in a paired datacenter.

trans-unit.source: These extra copies help ensure that your backup data is highly available even if an Azure site-level disaster occurs.
trans-unit.target: These extra copies help ensure that your backup data is highly available even if an Azure site-level disaster occurs.

trans-unit.source: There is no charge for any egress (outbound) data transfer during a restore operation from the Backup vault.
trans-unit.target: There is no charge for any egress (outbound) data transfer during a restore operation from the Backup vault.

trans-unit.source: Data inbound to Azure is also free.
trans-unit.target: Data inbound to Azure is also free.

trans-unit.source: Works with the import service where it is available.
trans-unit.target: Works with the import service where it is available.

trans-unit.source: Data encryption allows for secure transmission and storage of customer data in the public cloud.
trans-unit.target: Data encryption allows for secure transmission and storage of customer data in the public cloud.

trans-unit.source: The encryption passphrase is stored at the source, and it is never transmitted or stored in Azure.
trans-unit.target: The encryption passphrase is stored at the source, and it is never transmitted or stored in Azure.

trans-unit.source: The encryption key is required to restore any of the data, and only the customer has full access to the data in the service.
trans-unit.target: The encryption key is required to restore any of the data, and only the customer has full access to the data in the service.

trans-unit.source: Application-consistent backups on Windows help ensure that fixes are not needed at the time of restore, which reduces the recovery time objective.
trans-unit.target: Application-consistent backups on Windows help ensure that fixes are not needed at the time of restore, which reduces the recovery time objective.

trans-unit.source: This allows customers to return to a running state more quickly.
trans-unit.target: This allows customers to return to a running state more quickly.

trans-unit.source: Rather than pay for off-site tape backup solutions, customers can back up to Azure, which provides a compelling tape-like solution at a low cost.
trans-unit.target: Rather than pay for off-site tape backup solutions, customers can back up to Azure, which provides a compelling tape-like solution at a low cost.

trans-unit.source: Because Backup is a hybrid backup solution, it consists of multiple components that work together to enable end-to-end backup and restore workflows.
trans-unit.target: Because Backup is a hybrid backup solution, it consists of multiple components that work together to enable end-to-end backup and restore workflows.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Backup agent can be deployed on any Windows Server VM that runs in Azure.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Backup agent can be deployed on any Windows Server VM that runs in Azure.

trans-unit.source: The Backup agent can be deployed on any Windows Server VM or physical machine.
trans-unit.target: The Backup agent can be deployed on any Windows Server VM or physical machine.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [how to protect workloads in Azure by using System Center DPM](http://blogs.technet.com/b/dpm/archive/2014/09/02/azure-iaas-workload-protection-using-data-protection-manager.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [how to protect workloads in Azure by using System Center DPM](http://blogs.technet.com/b/dpm/archive/2014/09/02/azure-iaas-workload-protection-using-data-protection-manager.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [how to protect workloads and VMs in your datacenter](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh758173.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [how to protect workloads and VMs in your datacenter](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh758173.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [how to protect workloads in Azure by using Azure Backup Server](backup-azure-microsoft-azure-backup.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [how to protect workloads in Azure by using Azure Backup Server](backup-azure-microsoft-azure-backup.md).

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [how to protect workloads in Azure by using Azure Backup Server](backup-azure-microsoft-azure-backup.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [how to protect workloads in Azure by using Azure Backup Server](backup-azure-microsoft-azure-backup.md).

trans-unit.source: Specialized for [backup of Azure infrastructure as a service (IaaS) virtual machines](backup-azure-vms-introduction.md).
trans-unit.target: Specialized for [backup of Azure infrastructure as a service (IaaS) virtual machines](backup-azure-vms-introduction.md).

trans-unit.source: Use System Center DPM to back up virtual machines in your datacenter.
trans-unit.target: Use System Center DPM to back up virtual machines in your datacenter.

trans-unit.source: Can backup files and folders on a Windows OS machine, be it physical or virtual (VMs can be anywhere on-premises or Azure)
trans-unit.target: Can backup files and folders on a Windows OS machine, be it physical or virtual (VMs can be anywhere on-premises or Azure)

trans-unit.source: Three times a day backup/file level restore
trans-unit.target: Three times a day backup/file level restore

trans-unit.source: File/folder/volume level restore only, not application aware
trans-unit.target: File/folder/volume level restore only, not application aware

trans-unit.source: Full flexibility for when to take backups
trans-unit.target: Full flexibility for when to take backups

trans-unit.source: Lack of heterogeneous support (VMware VM back up, Oracle workload back up).
trans-unit.target: Lack of heterogeneous support (VMware VM back up, Oracle workload back up).

trans-unit.source: Full flexibility for when to take backups
trans-unit.target: Full flexibility for when to take backups

trans-unit.source: Does not require a System Center license
trans-unit.target: Does not require a System Center license

trans-unit.source: Lack of heterogeneous support (VMware VM back up, Oracle workload back up).
trans-unit.target: Lack of heterogeneous support (VMware VM back up, Oracle workload back up).

trans-unit.source: Fabric level backup with no backup infrastructure needed
trans-unit.target: Fabric level backup with no backup infrastructure needed

trans-unit.source: Once a day back up/disk level restore
trans-unit.target: Once a day back up/disk level restore

trans-unit.source: Which applications and workloads can be backed up?
trans-unit.target: Which applications and workloads can be backed up?

trans-unit.source: [System Center DPM](backup-azure-dpm-introduction.md) (+ the Azure Backup agent),
trans-unit.target: [System Center DPM](backup-azure-dpm-introduction.md) (+ the Azure Backup agent),

trans-unit.source: [System Center DPM](backup-azure-dpm-introduction.md) (+ the Azure Backup agent),
trans-unit.target: [System Center DPM](backup-azure-dpm-introduction.md) (+ the Azure Backup agent),

trans-unit.source: [System Center DPM](backup-azure-backup-sql.md) (+ the Azure Backup agent),
trans-unit.target: [System Center DPM](backup-azure-backup-sql.md) (+ the Azure Backup agent),

trans-unit.source: [System Center DPM](backup-azure-backup-sql.md) (+ the Azure Backup agent),
trans-unit.target: [System Center DPM](backup-azure-backup-sql.md) (+ the Azure Backup agent),

trans-unit.source: [System Center DPM](backup-azure-backup-sql.md) (+ the Azure Backup agent),
trans-unit.target: [System Center DPM](backup-azure-backup-sql.md) (+ the Azure Backup agent),

trans-unit.source: [System Center DPM](backup-azure-backup-sql.md) (+ the Azure Backup agent),
trans-unit.target: [System Center DPM](backup-azure-backup-sql.md) (+ the Azure Backup agent),

trans-unit.source: [System Center DPM](backup-azure-backup-sql.md) (+ the Azure Backup agent),
trans-unit.target: [System Center DPM](backup-azure-backup-sql.md) (+ the Azure Backup agent),

trans-unit.source: Only Hyper-V (Not Azure VM) Only file-consistent backup is possible
trans-unit.target: Only Hyper-V (Not Azure VM) Only file-consistent backup is possible

trans-unit.source: Only Hyper-V (Not Azure VM) Only file-consistent backup is possible (Same as DPM)
trans-unit.target: Only Hyper-V (Not Azure VM) Only file-consistent backup is possible (Same as DPM)

trans-unit.source: In Public Preview - Linux VMs in Resource Manager deployment model
trans-unit.target: In Public Preview - Linux VMs in Resource Manager deployment model

trans-unit.source: Yes for Linux VMs in classic deployment model
trans-unit.target: Yes for Linux VMs in classic deployment model

trans-unit.source: These five tables summarize how backup functionality is handled in each component.
trans-unit.target: These five tables summarize how backup functionality is handled in each component.

trans-unit.source: The Backup vault is the preferred storage target across all components.
trans-unit.target: The Backup vault is the preferred storage target across all components.

trans-unit.source: System Center DPM and Backup Server also provide the option to have a local disk copy.
trans-unit.target: System Center DPM and Backup Server also provide the option to have a local disk copy.

trans-unit.source: However, only System Center DPM provides the option to write data to a tape storage device.
trans-unit.target: However, only System Center DPM provides the option to write data to a tape storage device.

trans-unit.source: Every component supports incremental backup regardless of the target storage (disk, tape, backup vault).
trans-unit.target: Every component supports incremental backup regardless of the target storage (disk, tape, backup vault).

trans-unit.source: Incremental backup ensures that backups are storage and time efficient, by transferring only those changes made since the last backup.
trans-unit.target: Incremental backup ensures that backups are storage and time efficient, by transferring only those changes made since the last backup.

trans-unit.source: Backups are compressed to reduce the required storage space.
trans-unit.target: Backups are compressed to reduce the required storage space.

trans-unit.source: The only component that does not use compression is the VM extension.
trans-unit.target: The only component that does not use compression is the VM extension.

trans-unit.source: With VM extension, all backup data is copied from the customer storage account to the backup vault in the same region without compressing it.
trans-unit.target: With VM extension, all backup data is copied from the customer storage account to the backup vault in the same region without compressing it.

trans-unit.source: While going without compression slightly inflates the storage used, storing the data without compression allows for faster restore times.
trans-unit.target: While going without compression slightly inflates the storage used, storing the data without compression allows for faster restore times.

trans-unit.source: Deduplication is supported for System Center DPM and Backup Server when it is [deployed in a Hyper-V virtual machine](http://blogs.technet.com/b/dpm/archive/2015/01/06/deduplication-of-dpm-storage-reduce-dpm-storage-consumption.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Deduplication is supported for System Center DPM and Backup Server when it is [deployed in a Hyper-V virtual machine](http://blogs.technet.com/b/dpm/archive/2015/01/06/deduplication-of-dpm-storage-reduce-dpm-storage-consumption.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Deduplication is performed at the host level by using Windows Server deduplication on virtual hard disks (VHDs) that are attached to the virtual machine as backup storage.
trans-unit.target: Deduplication is performed at the host level by using Windows Server deduplication on virtual hard disks (VHDs) that are attached to the virtual machine as backup storage.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] Deduplication is not available in Azure for any of the Backup components.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] Deduplication is not available in Azure for any of the Backup components.

trans-unit.source: When System Center DPM and Backup Server are deployed in Azure, the storage disks attached to the VM cannot be deduplicated.
trans-unit.target: When System Center DPM and Backup Server are deployed in Azure, the storage disks attached to the VM cannot be deduplicated.

trans-unit.source: All backup traffic from your servers to the Backup vault is encrypted by using Advanced Encryption Standard 256.
trans-unit.target: All backup traffic from your servers to the Backup vault is encrypted by using Advanced Encryption Standard 256.

trans-unit.source: The data is sent over a secure HTTPS link.
trans-unit.target: The data is sent over a secure HTTPS link.

trans-unit.source: The backup data is also stored in the Backup vault in encrypted form.
trans-unit.target: The backup data is also stored in the Backup vault in encrypted form.

trans-unit.source: Only the customer holds the passphrase to unlock this data.
trans-unit.target: Only the customer holds the passphrase to unlock this data.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft cannot decrypt the backup data at any point.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft cannot decrypt the backup data at any point.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] The key used to encrypt the backup data is present only with the customer.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] The key used to encrypt the backup data is present only with the customer.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft does not maintain a copy in Azure and does not have any access to the key.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft does not maintain a copy in Azure and does not have any access to the key.

trans-unit.source: If the key is misplaced, Microsoft cannot recover the backup data.
trans-unit.target: If the key is misplaced, Microsoft cannot recover the backup data.

trans-unit.source: Backing up Azure VMs requires setting up encryption *within* the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Backing up Azure VMs requires setting up encryption *within* the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Use BitLocker on Windows virtual machines and **dm-crypt** on Linux virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Use BitLocker on Windows virtual machines and **dm-crypt** on Linux virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup does not automatically encrypt backup data that comes through this path.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup does not automatically encrypt backup data that comes through this path.

trans-unit.source: Because the VM extension reads the data directly from the Azure storage account over the storage network, it is not necessary to optimize this traffic.
trans-unit.target: Because the VM extension reads the data directly from the Azure storage account over the storage network, it is not necessary to optimize this traffic.

trans-unit.source: The traffic is over the local storage network in the Azure datacenter, so there is little need for compression because of bandwidth considerations.
trans-unit.target: The traffic is over the local storage network in the Azure datacenter, so there is little need for compression because of bandwidth considerations.

trans-unit.source: If you are backing up your data to a backup server (DPM or Backup Server), traffic from the primary server to the backup server can be compressed to save on bandwidth.
trans-unit.target: If you are backing up your data to a backup server (DPM or Backup Server), traffic from the primary server to the backup server can be compressed to save on bandwidth.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Backup agent provides throttling capability, which allows you to control how network bandwidth is used during data transfer.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Backup agent provides throttling capability, which allows you to control how network bandwidth is used during data transfer.

trans-unit.source: Throttling can be helpful if you need to back up data during work hours but do not want the backup process to interfere with other internet traffic.
trans-unit.target: Throttling can be helpful if you need to back up data during work hours but do not want the backup process to interfere with other internet traffic.

trans-unit.source: Throttling for data transfer applies to back up and restore activities.
trans-unit.target: Throttling for data transfer applies to back up and restore activities.

trans-unit.source: What is the vault credential file?
trans-unit.target: What is the vault credential file?

trans-unit.source: The vault credentials file is a certificate generated by the portal for each backup vault.
trans-unit.target: The vault credentials file is a certificate generated by the portal for each backup vault.

trans-unit.source: The portal then uploads the public key to the Access Control Service (ACS).
trans-unit.target: The portal then uploads the public key to the Access Control Service (ACS).

trans-unit.source: The private key is provided to the user when downloading the credentials and then entered during the machine registration.
trans-unit.target: The private key is provided to the user when downloading the credentials and then entered during the machine registration.

trans-unit.source: The private key authenticates the machine to send backup data to an identified vault in the Azure Backup service.
trans-unit.target: The private key authenticates the machine to send backup data to an identified vault in the Azure Backup service.

trans-unit.source: The vault credential is used only during the registration workflow.
trans-unit.target: The vault credential is used only during the registration workflow.

trans-unit.source: It is your responsibility to ensure that the vault credentials file is not compromised.
trans-unit.target: It is your responsibility to ensure that the vault credentials file is not compromised.

trans-unit.source: If it falls in the hands of any rogue-user, the vault credentials file can be used to register other machines against the same vault.
trans-unit.target: If it falls in the hands of any rogue-user, the vault credentials file can be used to register other machines against the same vault.

trans-unit.source: However, since the backup data is encrypted using a passphrase belonging only to the customer, existing backup data cannot be compromised.
trans-unit.target: However, since the backup data is encrypted using a passphrase belonging only to the customer, existing backup data cannot be compromised.

trans-unit.source: To mitigate this concern, vault credentials are set to expire in 48 hours.
trans-unit.target: To mitigate this concern, vault credentials are set to expire in 48 hours.

trans-unit.source: While you can download the vault credentials of a backup vault any number of times, only the latest file is applicable during the registration workflow.
trans-unit.target: While you can download the vault credentials of a backup vault any number of times, only the latest file is applicable during the registration workflow.

trans-unit.source: How does Azure Backup differ from Azure Site Recovery?
trans-unit.target: How does Azure Backup differ from Azure Site Recovery?

trans-unit.source: Many customers confuse backup recovery and disaster recovery.
trans-unit.target: Many customers confuse backup recovery and disaster recovery.

trans-unit.source: Both capture data and provide restore semantics, but their core value propositions are different.
trans-unit.target: Both capture data and provide restore semantics, but their core value propositions are different.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup backs up data on-premises and in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup backs up data on-premises and in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery coordinates virtual-machine and physical-server replication, failover, and failback.
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery coordinates virtual-machine and physical-server replication, failover, and failback.

trans-unit.source: Both services are important because your disaster recovery solution needs to keep your data safe and recoverable (Backup) *and* keep your workloads available (Site Recovery) when outages occur.
trans-unit.target: Both services are important because your disaster recovery solution needs to keep your data safe and recoverable (Backup) *and* keep your workloads available (Site Recovery) when outages occur.

trans-unit.source: The following concepts help you make important decisions around backup and disaster recovery.
trans-unit.target: The following concepts help you make important decisions around backup and disaster recovery.

trans-unit.source: The amount of acceptable data loss if a recovery needs to be done.
trans-unit.target: The amount of acceptable data loss if a recovery needs to be done.

trans-unit.source: Backup solutions have wide variability in their acceptable RPO.
trans-unit.target: Backup solutions have wide variability in their acceptable RPO.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machine backups usually have an RPO of one day, while database backups have RPOs as low as 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machine backups usually have an RPO of one day, while database backups have RPOs as low as 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Disaster recovery solutions have low RPOs.
trans-unit.target: Disaster recovery solutions have low RPOs.

trans-unit.source: The DR copy can be behind by a few seconds or a few minutes.
trans-unit.target: The DR copy can be behind by a few seconds or a few minutes.

trans-unit.source: The amount of time that it takes to complete a recovery or restore.
trans-unit.target: The amount of time that it takes to complete a recovery or restore.

trans-unit.source: Because of the larger RPO, the amount of data that a backup solution needs to process is typically much higher, which leads to longer RTOs.
trans-unit.target: Because of the larger RPO, the amount of data that a backup solution needs to process is typically much higher, which leads to longer RTOs.

trans-unit.source: For example, it can take days to restore data from tapes, depending on the time it takes to transport the tape from an off-site location.
trans-unit.target: For example, it can take days to restore data from tapes, depending on the time it takes to transport the tape from an off-site location.

trans-unit.source: Disaster recovery solutions have smaller RTOs because they are more in sync with the source.
trans-unit.target: Disaster recovery solutions have smaller RTOs because they are more in sync with the source.

trans-unit.source: Fewer changes need to be processed.
trans-unit.target: Fewer changes need to be processed.

trans-unit.source: How long data needs to be stored
trans-unit.target: How long data needs to be stored

trans-unit.source: For scenarios that require operational recovery (data corruption, inadvertent file deletion, OS failure), backup data is typically retained for 30 days or less.
trans-unit.target: For scenarios that require operational recovery (data corruption, inadvertent file deletion, OS failure), backup data is typically retained for 30 days or less.

trans-unit.source: From a compliance standpoint, data might need to be stored for months or even years.
trans-unit.target: From a compliance standpoint, data might need to be stored for months or even years.

trans-unit.source: Backup data is ideally suited for archiving in such cases.
trans-unit.target: Backup data is ideally suited for archiving in such cases.

trans-unit.source: Disaster recovery needs only operational recovery data, which typically takes a few hours or up to a day.
trans-unit.target: Disaster recovery needs only operational recovery data, which typically takes a few hours or up to a day.

trans-unit.source: Because of the fine-grained data capture used in DR solutions, using DR data for long-term retention is not recommended.
trans-unit.target: Because of the fine-grained data capture used in DR solutions, using DR data for long-term retention is not recommended.

trans-unit.target: Try out a simple Azure Backup.

trans-unit.target: For instructions, see one of these tutorials:

trans-unit.target: Because those tutorials help you back up quickly, they show you only the most direct path for backing up your data.
